intro: Draba asprella var. kaibabensis, commonly known as the Kaibab Draba, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and hairy foliage. This variety is typically found in rocky, alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features reflect adaptations to its harsh, arid habitat, making it a resilient and specialized species.
